title: Google has a new program to protect that Pixel you just ordered
description: Say goodbye Preferred Care and hello to Pixel Care Plus.
content:
If you were worried about having an accident with your Pixel phone, Google offered an insurance program called Preferred Care to help protect your device. This service would allow you to have repairs done or receive replacements in the case of a mishap. We’re using the past tense here because Google has now replaced this program with a new one.

Today, the Mountain View-based firm launched a new device protection program called Pixel Care Plus. This program is in partnership with Asurion, which diverges from Google’s former collaboration with Assurant for Preferred Care. In the announcement, Google claims that the new program offers “a higher level of coverage, service, and peace of mind for Google hardware owners.”

Along with the new program, Google is offering a few new benefits that include: The tech giant adds that Pixel Care Plus customers get free upgraded shipping on replacements (including next-day shipping). Customers will be able to file claims from the Google Store and select a location and time for the repair. Alternatively, you can also to submit a claim through the My Pixel app, formerly known as Pixel Tips.

As for the prices, Google offers a breakdown in the screenshot below. You can check out the prices for other eligible devices on the Pixel Care Plus website.

There are some stipulations you should be aware of. Pixel owners will have 60 days after purchase to sign their device up for Pixel Care Plus. The device must also be one of the products that Google considers eligible. At the moment, that includes the Pixel 8 and up, the Pixel Watch 2 and up, the Pixel Tablet, the Fitbit Ace LTE, the Fitbit Versa 4, the Fitbit Sense 2, the Fitbit Charge 6, and the Fitbit Inspire 3. Last but not least, you’ll need to be in the US, but where you purchased your device won’t matter.

Just like submitting claims, you’ll be able to add a device to the program from the Google Store or through the My Pixel app. For those of you who are current monthly subscribers of Google Preferred Care and Fi Device Protection, Google says you’ll be migrated over to this new program in the coming months.
summary: Google has launched a new device protection program, Pixel Care Plus, in partnership with Asurion. The new program offers a higher level of coverage, service, and peace of mind for Google hardware owners. Customers will be able to file claims from the Google Store or submit them through the My Pixel app. The program also includes free upgraded shipping on replacements. However, users must be in the US within 60 days after purchase to sign up for the program.
shortSummary: Google has launched Pixel Care Plus, a new insurance program with Asurion, offering enhanced device protection and upgraded shipping for replacements.

Affiliate links on Android Authority may earn us a commission. Learn more.
Want more Android Authority? How to set us as your preferred source in Google Search
August 12, 2025
Since 2007, Android Authority has strived to bring all of our readers the very best coverage of Android and the mobile tech world. And even after 18+ years as a proudly independent media outlet, we’re as driven as we’ve ever been to bring you all the latest exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, hands-on reviews, experience-based features, lab testing, and other expert analysis.
Of course, how we’ve been able to get that coverage to you has changed in countless ways during that time, be it via our website, YouTube channel, social media, or new projects like Authority Insights, which combines our elite reporting with a podcast and a newsletter, as well as our brand new YouTube channel from Android Authority‘s Pixel guy, C. Scott Brown.
We want to continue to bring you the very best Android and mobile tech coverage, and you can help us do that.
We know and deeply appreciate that so many of you repeatedly visit our website and other channels to constantly see what we’ve been working on, often every day. Every one of those clicks or interactions helps us remain independent and every bit as innovative and ambitious as we’ve been since day one.
So, if you want to see even more of our content, guarantee you don’t miss anything from us, or just want to continue to support our mission, we’d like to ask you a big favor and set Android Authority as a preferred source in Google Search. It only takes a few seconds, it doesn’t cost you anything, and it will help us continue to bring you the best possible content for the next decade and beyond.
This feature is currently only available in the US and India, but we’ll let you know when other regions are included in this new feature. For those who already have it, here’s how to do it:
How to set Android Authority as a preferred source
Method 1:
- Head to this link and you can add us directly to your list of preferred sources.
Method 2:
- Search for a topic that’s in the news and find the “Top stories” header. If you don’t see this, you might need to input a different query. “Galaxy S26 Pro” worked for us at the time of writing.
- Click on the icon on the right of the “Top stories” header. That’s the icon with the stacked squares and a star on top.
- Search for “Android Authority” and select it to set it as a preferred source. You can add other websites at this stage, too — support your favorite publications!
- Refresh your search results to see more from your favorite sites.
Once again, a big thank you to all our readers, viewers, and followers — your passion for Android and tech is what pushes us forward. We hope you’ll add us as a preferred source (and please feel free to encourage any other tech enthusiasts you know to do the same!), but even if you don’t, we’re grateful for every one of you that supports our work in any way possible. And as ever, if you have any feedback for us, please drop an email to contact@androidauthority.com.
Thank you for being part of our community. Read our Comment Policy before posting.

Android Authority is a community of technology enthusiasts. We’re brought together by our interest in all things tech, regardless of brand, platform, and price point. Our writers care deeply about the topics they cover, and so do our readers.
Because we’re all passionate, it’s easy for discussions around certain topics to become heated, but that’s not an excuse for discussions to degenerate.
Here are the general rules that cover commenting on Android Authority platforms, including on-site comment sections, YouTube, and various social media channels.
Do’s
- Always be civil.
- Read the content before commenting.
- Post thoughtful comments that meaningfully contribute to the discussion.
- Give constructive criticism in response to posts and other comments.
- Ignore the trolls, they crave attention.
- Downvote low-quality comments. Flag spam and abusive comments.
Don’ts
- Attack commenters, Android Authority staff, or other individuals.
- Post off-topic comments.
- Post abusive, insulting, threatening, harassing, sexist, racist, misogynist, homophobic comments.
- Reveal personal information of any individuals.
- Spam, self-promote, impersonate.
- Post low-effort comments that don’t add anything to the discussion.
- Post porn, gore, or other NSFW content.
- Post or link to pirated content of any type.
- Post slanderous or defamatory comments.
House rules
- Comments are solely the opinions of the individuals leaving them. In no way does Android Authority endorse or condone them.
- Failure to comply with the guidelines above may result in your comments being deleted or moderated.
- Repeat and serious offenders will be banned.
- We reserve the right to delete or moderate comments at any time and at our sole discretion.
- This policy may be changed at any time and at our sole discretion.

Innan du fortsätter till Google
Vi använder cookies och data för att
- leverera och underhålla Googles tjänster
- spåra avbrott och skydda mot spam, bedrägeri och otillåten användning
- mäta målgruppsengagemang och webbplatsstatistik så att vi kan analysera hur våra tjänster används och förbättra tjänsternas kvalitet.
Om du väljer knappen Godkänn alla använder vi även cookies och data för att
- utveckla och förbättra nya tjänster
- leverera annonser och mäta hur effektiva de är
- visa anpassat innehåll utifrån dina inställningar
- visa anpassade annonser utifrån dina inställningar
Om du väljer knappen Avvisa alla använder vi inte cookies i dessa ytterligare syften.
Innehåll utan anpassning påverkas bland annat av vad du tittar på för tillfället, aktivitet i din aktiva söksession och din plats. Innehåll utan anpassning påverkas bland annat av vad du tittar på för tillfället och din ungefärliga plats. Innehåll och annonser med anpassning kan även omfatta mer relevanta resultat, rekommendationer och anpassade annonser utifrån tidigare aktivitet i webbläsaren, till exempel tidigare sökningar på Google. Vi använder även cookies och data för att anpassa upplevelsen efter lämplighet för din målgrupp, om tillämpligt.
Välj knappen Fler alternativ för mer information, till exempel om hur du hanterar dina integritetsinställningar. Du kan även besöka g.co/privacytools när som helst.

Protect your new devices with Pixel Care+
Today we’re launching Pixel Care+, our new flagship device protection program for Made by Google products. Pixel Care+ will provide a higher level of coverage, service and peace of mind for Google hardware owners. New benefits include:
- Unlimited claims for accidental damage, extended warranty claims and mechanical damage
- $0 screen and battery repairs
- $0 post-warranty malfunction claims
- Genuine Google parts and replacements
- Priority Support from Pixel Experts
- Self-service claims through the Google Store website
- Optional added loss and theft coverage
Pixel Care+ offers industry-leading coverage for Pixel devices, including $0 deductibles for the most common repairs like screen and battery replacements and other accidental damage. Pixel Care+ users get free upgraded shipping on replacements, including next-day shipping. Pixel Care+ is offered in partnership with Asurion, a trusted provider for device protection and more.
We’ve improved the claims process so it’s easy and intuitive to get phones fixed or replaced. Open your claim directly from the Google Store and select a location and time for your repair. You can also add Pixel Care+ and file a claim directly in the new My Pixel App.
Pixel Care+ is available in the U.S. starting today for new eligible devices, and can be added within 60 days of purchase regardless of where you bought your Made by Google device from. Add Pixel Care+ to your eligible devices by visiting the Google Store or through the new My Pixel App.
Current monthly subscribers of Google Preferred Care and Fi Device Protection in the U.S. will be migrated to the new program in the coming months.
Learn more about Pixel Care+ on our website.

argos_summary: Google has replaced its former Preferred Care insurance with a new Pixel Care Plus program, partnering with Asurion to offer extensive coverage for Pixel devices. The service includes unlimited accidental damage claims, zero‑cost screen and battery repairs, priority support, and free upgraded shipping, and can be added within 60 days of purchase for eligible products such as Pixel 8+, Pixel Watch 2+, and various Fitbits. Customers can file claims via the Google Store or My Pixel app, and existing Preferred Care subscribers will be migrated to Pixel Care Plus. The program is available only in the U.S. and covers a range of devices including phones, watches, tablets, and fitness trackers.
